content.text: The dimensions of a cuboid are in the ratio of 6:5:2 (l:b:h). If the total surface area is 104 \(m^2\). What is the length of the cuboid?
What is the Breadth of the cuboid?

solution.text:
Let length:breadth:height = 6x:5x:2x
Therefore, Surface Area of the cuboid = \(2(6 \times 5x^2 + 5 \times 2x^2 + 2 \times 6x^2)\)
= \(2(52)x^2\)
= \(104x^2\)
Given that surface area is \(104 m^2\)
Therefore, \(104 m^2 = 104 x^2\)
\(\Rightarrow x^2 = \frac{104}{104}\)
\(\Rightarrow x = \sqrt{1}\)
\(\Rightarrow\) x = 1 metres

content.text: What is the Height of the cuboid?

hint.text: Surface Area of the cuboid = \(2 (lb + bh + lh)\)

solution.text:
Total surface area of all the cubes \(= 5 \times 6 \times 1.2^2 = 43.2 cm^2\)
Area of each face =\(1.2^2 cm^2 = 1.44 cm^2\)
Number of faces that face inward = 10 faces
Therefore, outer surface area = 43.2 - 14.4 = 28.8 \(cm^2\)
Cost of paint = Rs 15 per \(cm^2\)
Therefore, total cost of painting the object = \(28.8 \times 15\)
= Rs. 432

content.text: Five cubes of edge 1.2 cm each are placed side by side and stuck together as shown. The cost of painting is Rs 15 per \(cm^2\). What is the cost of painting the outer surface of the entire object?

hint.text: Count the number of faces that are outward facing

solution.text:
The surface area of the box \(= 2 (34 \times 17 + 17 \times 9 + 34 \times 9) = 2074 cm^2\)
Cost of painting the box = Rs. 1.6 per \(cm^2\)
Therefore, total cost of painting the box = \(2074 \times 1.6\)
= Rs. 3318.4

content.text: Latika needs to paint a rectangular box from the outside. The cost of painting the box is Rs. 1.6 per \(cm^2.\) If the dimensions of the box are \(34 cm \times 17 cm \times 9 cm\), what is the total cost of painting the box?

hint.text: Start by calculating the surface area

solution.text:
Curved Surface area of the roller \(= 2 \pi rh = 2\pi \times \frac {5}2 \times 33 = 518.57 cm^2\)
Area covered per rotation \(= 518.57 cm^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Area painted in 55 rolls \(= 518.57 \times 55 = 28521.43 cm^2\)

content.text: Last Monday, Ram painted a rectangular wall with a cylindrical paint roller. The length of the roller is 33 cm and its diameter is 5 cm. While painting, the roller rolled over 55 times completely. What surface area did Ram paint?

hint.text: How much area does the roller cover in one rotation?

solution.text:
Total surface area \(= 6 \times 23^2 = 6 (side)^2\)
\(\Rightarrow\) Length of side = \((\frac {3174}{6})^{\frac 12} = 23 cm\)

content.text: A closed box in the shape of a cube has a total outer surface area of 3174 \(cm^2.\) What is the length of its side in centimetres?

hint.text: Remember that surface area of a cube is \(6 \times side^2\)

solution.text: Surface Area of a cube = \(6 \times length^2 = 1014 cm^2\)

solution.text: Surface Area of a cuboid = \(2(ab + bc + ca) = 2 (40.5 + 13.5 + 27) = 162 dm^2\)

content.text: See the cuboid below, a=9 dm, b=4.5 dm, c=3 dm, Find its surface area

solution.text: Surface Area of a cylinder = \(2 \times \pi \times r \times(r + h) = 792 cm^2\)

content.text: In the cylinder below, diameter=14 cm, h=11 cm, find its surface area

solution.text:
Surface Area = Curved surface area of outer cylinder + Curved surface area of inner cylinder + Area of both rims
\(= 2\pi {r_ o}h + 2\pi {r_ i}h + 2\pi ({r_ o}^2 - {r_ i}^2)\)
\(= 3080 + 2640 + 326.86 = 6046.86 cm^2\)

content.text: In the hollow cylinder below, Inner Radius =12 cm, Outer Radius = 14 cm, Height = 35 cm, find its surface area
Find the surface area of the objects below:

hint.text:
Remember the following formulas:
Surface Area of the Cube:\( 6 \times side^2\)
Surface Area of the Cuboid: \(2 \times (lb + bh + lh)\)
Surface area of a cylinder:\(2\pi r(r+h)\)

solution.text:
Area of tin sheet required for 1 box = Surface area of one box
\(= 2 (9 \times 6 + 6 \times 4 + 9 \times 4) = 228 cm^2\)
Therefore, area of tin required for 10 boxes \(= 228 \times 10\)
\(= 2280 cm^2\)

content.text: You need to create a tin box of dimensions \(9 cm \times 6 cm \times 4 cm.\) What is the area of a sheet of tin required to make 10 such tins?

hint.text: Start by calculating the surface area of the box
